sentences.en: A balloon floated across the sky.
A balloon popped, sounding like a gunshot.
sentences.cn: 一只气球爆裂了，听着像是枪响。

sentences.en: a huge balloon shaped like a giant cow
sentences.cn: 形似一头巨牛的大气球

sentences.en: Can you help me blow up these balloons?
sentences.cn: 你帮我把这些气球吹起来好吗？

sentences.en: Don't blow the balloon up any further! It'll burst!
sentences.cn: 别给气球多充气了! 它会破的!

sentences.en: He burst the balloon in my face.
sentences.cn: 他对着我的脸弄爆了气球。

sentences.en: He popped the balloon with a pin.
It wasn't a balloon — I'm certain of that.
sentences.cn: 那不是气球，这点我敢肯定。

sentences.en: My shirt bags like a balloon when the wind blows against it.
sentences.cn: 风吹着我的衬衫使它膨胀得象个气球一样.

sentences.en: That balloon will burst if you blow it up any more.
sentences.cn: 你再给气球充气，它就要爆了。

sentences.en: That was the year when the balloon went up.
The balloon enlarged as we pumped air into it.
sentences.cn: 那个气球充气后就变大了.

sentences.en: The balloon rose up slowly into the air.
The balloon soared up on a gust of wind.
sentences.cn: 一阵狂风把气球吹向风中.

sentences.en: The balloon will pop if you put a pin in it.
sentences.cn: 如果扎进一颗大头钉,气球就会突然爆开.

sentences.en: The company’s debt has ballooned in the past year.
sentences.cn: 在过去一年里，公司的债务激增。

words.tran_cn: 使像气球般鼓起；使激增

phrases.tran_cn: [外科学]气囊血管成形术；球囊成形术（等于percutaneous transluminal angioplasty）
毫无效果，毫无作用(意指如铅气球无法飞升)

phrases.phrase: when (或 before) the balloon goes up
phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)行动（或麻烦）开始（之前）

trans.tran_en: an object made of brightly coloured thin rubber, that is filled with air and used as a toy or decoration for parties

trans.tran_cn: 膨胀，激增，乘热气球飞行
trans.tran_en: to suddenly become larger in amount
